car.picker.client
Class CarPointHandler

java.lang.Object
  car.picker.client.CarPointHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.KeyUpHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseDownHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseMoveHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseUpHandler, com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasSelectionHandlers<CarPoint>, com.google.gwt.event.shared.EventHandler, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers
public class CarPointHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseDownHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseUpHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseMoveHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.KeyUpHandler, com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasSelectionHandlers<CarPoint>

Handles drawing and user-interaction for a set of CarPoints.

Author:
Joshua

Deregisters all of this CarPointHandler handlers from its drawing canvas.

setCarSize

public void setCarSize(CarPoint.Size carSize)
Sets the car size to use when creating CarPoints. Also updates the currently focused CarPoint's size.

Parameters:
carSize - the new size.
See Also:

getCars

public java.util.List<CarPoint> getCars()
Returns an unmodifiable list of this CarPointHandler's registered CarPoints.

Returns:
this CarPointHandler's CarPoints.

findCarAt

public CarPoint findCarAt(Point2D point)
Returns the CarPoint at that location, or null if there are none. If the return value is non-null, then it is the first CarPoint such that CarPoint.onPoint(Point2D) returns true for the supplied point.

Parameters:
point - the point to test.
Returns:
the CarPoint at that point, or null.
See Also:
getCars()

clearCars

public void clearCars()
Removes every CarPoint from this CarPointHandler

getFocusedCar

public CarPoint getFocusedCar()
Returns the currently focused CarPoint, or null if there is none.

Returns:
the currently focused CarPoint, or null.
See Also:
setFocusedCar(CarPoint)

setFocusedCar

public void setFocusedCar(CarPoint carPoint)
Sets the currently focused CarPoint. Supply null to have no CarPoint focused.

Parameters:
carPoint - the CarPoint to focus, or null.
See Also:
getFocusedCar()

deleteFocusedCar

public void deleteFocusedCar()
Removes the currently focused CarPoint from this CarPointHandler.

See Also:

addCar

public CarPoint addCar(Point2D point)
Adds a movable CarPoint at the specified point.

Parameters:
point - where to add the CarPoint
Returns:
the CarPoint added.

addCar

public CarPoint addCar(Point2D point,
                       CarPoint.Size size,
                       boolean movable)
Adds a CarPoint of the specified size at the specified point. The CodePoint is movable if movable is set to true.

Parameters:
point - where to add the CarPoint
size - the size of the new CarPoint
movable - whether the CarPoint should be movable.
Returns:
the CarPoint added.

removeCar

private void removeCar(CarPoint carPoint)
Removes the specified CarPoint from this CarPointHandler .

Parameters:
carPoint - the CarPoint to remove.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied CarPoint not registered to this CarPointHandler.

draw

public void draw()
Draws this widget onto its drawing canvas. Simply draws the background image in the center and tells each registered CarPoint to draw itself onto the canvas. Always ends up redrawing this CarPointHandler.

redraw

public void redraw()
Simply calls draw(), which always redraws the CarPointHandler.

invalidate

public void invalidate()
Does nothing, as this CarPointHandler will always redraw itself when draw() is called.

getMousePoint

private Point2D getMousePoint(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseEvent<?> event)
Returns the position of the mouse specified by the event, relative to the drawing canvas' element.

Parameters:
event - the event to grab the mouse position from.
Returns:
the relative position of the mouse.

endDragging

private void endDragging()
Causes the focused element to no longer follow the mouse cursor.

startDragging

private void startDragging()
Causes the focused element to follow the mouse cursor.

See Also:
endDragging(), onMouseDown(MouseDownEvent)

isDragging

private boolean isDragging()
Returns whether the focused element is currently following the mouse cursor.

Returns:
whether the focused element is following the mouse.
See Also:
startDragging()

onMouseDown

public void onMouseDown(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseDownEvent event)
Responds to mouse-down events. If the location of the event is on a currently existing CarPoint, the method will start dragging on that element. Otherwise, the method will create a new CarPoint at the location of the click, with the current car size, and this method will start dragging on the newly created CarPoint.

Specified by:
onMouseDown in interface com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseDownHandler
See Also:
startDragging(), addCar(Point2D), getCarSize()

onMouseUp

public void onMouseUp(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseUpEvent event)
Responds to mouse-up events. Ends dragging, if an element is currently being dragged.

Specified by:
onMouseUp in interface com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseUpHandler

onMouseMove

public void onMouseMove(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseMoveEvent event)
Responds to mouse-move events. If an element is currently being dragged, this method updates its position to the mouse location specified by the supplied event.

Specified by:
onMouseMove in interface com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseMoveHandler

onKeyUp

public void onKeyUp(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.KeyUpEvent event)
Handles key events. If the "delete" or "backspace" button was hit, this method will delete the currently focused CarPoint, if there is one. If the "escape" button was hit, this method will unfocus the currently focused CarPoint.

Specified by:
onKeyUp in interface com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.KeyUpHandler
See Also:
deleteFocusedCar(), setFocusedCar(CarPoint)

addSelectionHandler

public com.google.gwt.event.shared.HandlerRegistration addSelectionHandler(com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.SelectionHandler<CarPoint> handler)
Registers the supplied SelectionHandler to this CarPointHandler. Registered SelectionHandlers will recieve events when the focused CarPoint is changed.

Specified by:
addSelectionHandler in interface com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasSelectionHandlers<CarPoint>

fireEvent

public void fireEvent(com.google.gwt.event.shared.GwtEvent<?> event)
Sends the supplied event to this CarPointHandler's appropriate registered handlers.

Specified by:
fireEvent in interface com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers
